words.definition: A global network of computers that allows people to share information and communicate.
sentences: We use the Internet to find information for our homework.
The Internet connects people all over the world.
My mom uses the Internet to shop online.

words.definition: A collection of web pages on the Internet about a specific topic or person.
sentences: I visited a fun website to play games.
Our school has a website with important announcements.
You can find many recipes on cooking websites.

words.definition: A way to send messages electronically from one computer to another.
sentences: I sent an email to my teacher about my project.
My dad checks his email every morning.
You need an email address to send and receive emails.

words.definition: A mobile phone that can do many things like browse the internet, take pictures, and run apps.
sentences: My brother uses his smartphone to listen to music.
Smartphones have made communication much easier.
I can call my grandparents with my smartphone.

words.definition: A short written message sent between mobile phones.
sentences: I sent a text message to my friend to ask about the party.
Text messages are quick and easy to send.
My mom often sends me text messages to remind me of things.

words.definition: Websites and apps that allow people to connect and share information, photos, and videos.
sentences: Many people use social media to stay in touch with friends.
Be careful what you share on social media.
News often spreads quickly on social media platforms.

words.definition: A program designed to perform a specific function directly for the user, especially on a smartphone or tablet.
sentences: I downloaded a new game app on my tablet.
There's an app for almost everything these days.
My favorite app helps me learn new languages.

words.definition: A phone call where you can see the person you are talking to on a screen.
sentences: I had a video call with my cousins who live far away.
Video calls are great for seeing family members.
We use video calls for online meetings.

words.definition: To talk to someone online by typing messages.
sentences: I like to chat with my friends in the evening.
We had a group chat to plan our trip.
The customer service agent helped me through an online chat.

words.definition: Connected to the Internet.
sentences: I spent the afternoon playing games online.
You can find a lot of information online.
Is your computer online right now?

words.definition: Not connected to the Internet.
sentences: I can't access that website because I'm offline.
Some games can be played offline.
When the power went out, we were offline.

words.definition: To copy data from one computer system to another, usually from the Internet to your device.
sentences: I need to download the new update for my game.
You can download music and movies from the Internet.
It took a long time to download the large file.

words.definition: To send data from your computer to another computer or to the Internet.
sentences: I will upload my photos to the cloud.
Please upload your homework to the school portal.
It takes a while to upload large video files.

words.definition: A program used to access and view websites on the Internet.
sentences: I use Chrome as my web browser.
You need a browser to surf the Internet.
My browser crashed, and I lost my work.

words.definition: A program that helps you find information on the Internet, like Google or Bing.
sentences: I used a search engine to find out about dinosaurs.
Google is a very popular search engine.
Type your question into the search engine to get answers.

words.definition: A secret word or phrase used to prove who you are and to access something, like an email account.
sentences: Always choose a strong password for your accounts.
I forgot my password and couldn't log in.
Never share your password with anyone.

words.definition: A name you choose to identify yourself when you log in to a website or app.
sentences: My username for the game is 'GamerKid'.
You need both a username and a password to log in.
Choose a username that is easy to remember.

words.definition: A page on a social media site or app that shows information about a person.
sentences: I updated my profile picture on my social media account.
My online profile shows my interests.
You can see other people's profiles on this app.

words.definition: To put a message, picture, or video on a social media site or forum.
sentences: She decided to post a picture of her cat online.
I saw your post about the school event.
Please don't post anything mean online.

words.definition: A written remark or opinion shared about something online, like a post or video.
sentences: I left a nice comment on my friend's photo.
Read the comments section to see what others think.
He received many positive comments on his artwork.

words.definition: To show approval or enjoyment of an online post, often by clicking a button.
sentences: My photo got many likes on Instagram.
Click 'like' if you enjoy this video.
She was happy to see her post had so many likes.

words.definition: To send something you found online to other people, or to post it for others to see.
sentences: I want to share this funny video with my friends.
You can share articles on social media.
Sharing information online can be helpful.

words.definition: To subscribe to someone's updates on a social media platform.
sentences: I follow my favorite artist on Twitter.
You can follow news channels to get updates.
She has many followers on her cooking channel.

words.definition: An alert or message that tells you about something new, like a new email or a friend's post.
sentences: I got a notification that I received a new email.
My phone buzzes with notifications all day.
Turn off notifications if you don't want to be disturbed.

words.definition: The state of being free from public attention; keeping your personal information safe online.
sentences: It's important to protect your privacy online.
Check your privacy settings on social media.
My privacy is important to me.

words.definition: Measures taken to protect information and systems from unauthorized access or damage.
sentences: Online security is very important to prevent hacking.
Use strong passwords for better security.
The website has good security features.

words.definition: Unwanted or junk email messages, often advertisements.
sentences: My email inbox is full of spam.
Be careful not to click on spam emails.
The filter helps keep spam out of my inbox.

words.definition: A trick used by criminals to get your personal information, like passwords, by pretending to be a trustworthy source.
sentences: Be aware of phishing emails that ask for your bank details.
Phishing is a common online scam.
Never click on suspicious links to avoid phishing.

words.definition: A harmful computer program that can damage your computer or steal your information.
sentences: My computer got a virus and stopped working.
Antivirus software helps protect against viruses.
Be careful when opening attachments to avoid computer viruses.

words.definition: A system that protects a computer network from unauthorized access.
sentences: A firewall helps keep your computer safe from online threats.
The company installed a strong firewall.
My computer's firewall blocked a suspicious connection.

words.definition: A technology that allows devices to connect to the Internet wirelessly.
sentences: Is there free Wi-Fi in this cafe?
I connected my tablet to the Wi-Fi network.
We need Wi-Fi to use the internet without cables.

words.definition: A technology that allows devices to connect and exchange data over short distances wirelessly.
sentences: I connected my headphones to my phone using Bluetooth.
Bluetooth is useful for connecting wireless accessories.
My car has Bluetooth for hands-free calls.

words.definition: Storing and accessing data and programs over the Internet instead of your computer's hard drive.
sentences: I save my photos to the cloud so I can access them anywhere.
Cloud storage helps you save space on your device.
Many online services use cloud computing.

words.definition: Playing video or audio content directly from the Internet without downloading it first.
sentences: I enjoy streaming movies on the weekend.
Streaming music saves space on my phone.
The internet speed needs to be fast for smooth streaming.

words.definition: An online seminar or presentation conducted over the Internet.
sentences: I attended a webinar about digital art.
Many companies offer free webinars to teach new skills.
The webinar was very informative.

words.definition: An online discussion group where people can post messages and reply to each other.
sentences: I found the answer to my question on an online forum.
The gaming forum has many helpful tips.
You can ask questions and get advice on a forum.

words.definition: Small digital images or icons used to express an idea, emotion, etc., in electronic communication.
sentences: I sent a happy face emoji to my friend.
Emojis help express feelings in text messages.
She used a lot of emojis in her message.

words.definition: A short, animated image file that loops continuously.
sentences: I sent a funny GIF to make my friend laugh.
GIFs are popular for expressing reactions online.
You can find many GIFs on social media.

words.definition: A set of rules or steps that a computer follows to solve a problem or complete a task.
sentences: Search engines use algorithms to show you relevant results.
The app's algorithm suggests new songs you might like.
Computer programs are built using algorithms.

words.definition: Facts and statistics collected together for reference or analysis by computers.
sentences: My phone stores a lot of personal data.
Companies collect data to understand their customers.
Protecting your data online is important.

words.definition: A computer program or device that provides a service to another computer program and its user, also known as the client.
sentences: The website went down because the server crashed.
Servers store information for many websites.
When you access a website, your computer connects to a server.

words.definition: A way of saving your files and data on remote servers, accessed over the Internet.
sentences: I use cloud storage to back up my important documents.
Cloud storage allows me to access my files from any device.
Many services offer free cloud storage up to a certain limit.

words.definition: The amount of data that can be sent over a network connection in a certain amount of time.
sentences: High bandwidth is needed for smooth video streaming.
Our internet plan has limited bandwidth.
More devices using the internet can reduce available bandwidth.

words.definition: The delay before a transfer of data begins following an instruction for its transfer.
sentences: High latency can make online gaming difficult.
Fiber optic cables reduce network latency.
I noticed some latency when I was video calling.

words.definition: A device that connects your home network to the Internet service provider.
sentences: The modem converts the internet signal for your computer.
You need both a modem and a router for home internet.
I checked the lights on the modem to see if the internet was working.

words.definition: A type of cable that uses light to transmit data very quickly.
sentences: Fiber optic internet is much faster than traditional cables.
Many new homes are being built with fiber optic connections.
Fiber optic technology is used for high-speed communication.

words.definition: Using radio waves to transmit signals, without physical wires.
sentences: I use a wireless mouse for my computer.
Wireless headphones are very convenient.
Our home network is completely wireless.

words.definition: A physical location where people can access the Internet, usually using Wi-Fi, via a wireless local area network (WLAN) with a router connected to an Internet service provider.
sentences: I found a public Wi-Fi hotspot at the coffee shop.
My phone can act as a mobile hotspot for my laptop.
Hotspots allow you to connect to the internet on the go.

words.definition: The address of a webpage or other resource on the Internet.
sentences: Type the URL into your browser to visit the website.
Every webpage has a unique URL.
I copied the URL to share the link with my friend.

words.definition: A link from a hypertext document to another location or file, typically activated by clicking on a highlighted word or image on the screen.
sentences: Click on the hyperlink to go to the next page.
The article contained many useful hyperlinks.
Hyperlinks connect different parts of the internet.

words.definition: The main page of a website, usually the first page you see.
sentences: Our school's homepage has all the latest news.
I set my favorite website as my browser's homepage.
The homepage gives an overview of the entire site.

words.definition: A box on a website or app where you can type words to search for information.
sentences: Type your question into the search bar.
The search bar is usually at the top of the page.
I used the search bar to find my old emails.

words.definition: A new window that suddenly appears on a computer screen, often for an advertisement.
sentences: Too many pop-ups can be annoying when browsing.
My browser blocked the pop-up advertisement.
Some websites use pop-ups for important notices.

words.definition: A small piece of data sent from a website and stored on the user's computer by the user's web browser while the user is browsing.
sentences: Websites use cookies to remember your preferences.
You can clear cookies from your browser settings.
Cookies help websites personalize your experience.

words.definition: A temporary storage area that holds frequently accessed data for quicker retrieval.
sentences: Clearing your browser's cache can fix loading issues.
The computer uses a cache to speed up operations.
Old website data might be stored in your cache.

words.definition: Software designed to detect and destroy computer viruses.
sentences: You should always have antivirus software installed.
Antivirus programs scan your computer for threats.
My antivirus alerted me to a suspicious file.

words.definition: The process of converting information or data into a code, especially to prevent unauthorized access.
sentences: Encryption keeps your online messages private.
Many websites use encryption to protect your data.
Strong encryption makes it hard for hackers to read information.

words.definition: The process of converting encrypted data back into its original form.
sentences: Only the person with the correct key can perform decryption.
Decryption is the opposite of encryption.
The message was unreadable until decryption.

words.definition: A security process in which a user provides two different authentication factors to verify themselves.
sentences: Using 2FA adds an extra layer of security to your accounts.
I use two-factor authentication for my email.
2FA often involves a code sent to your phone.

words.definition: A copy of computer data taken and stored elsewhere so that it may be used to restore the original after a data loss event.
sentences: Always make a backup of your important files.
I save my photos to an external hard drive as a backup.
Regular backups can prevent data loss.

words.definition: Storing copies of your data on remote servers accessible via the internet.
sentences: I use cloud backup for all my school projects.
Cloud backup is convenient because it's automatic.
If my computer breaks, I know my files are safe with cloud backup.

words.definition: The trail of data you leave behind when you use the Internet, including websites you visit, emails you send, and information you submit online.
sentences: Be mindful of your digital footprint, as it can last forever.
Everything you do online contributes to your digital footprint.
A positive digital footprint can help you in the future.

words.definition: Using electronic communication to bully a person, typically by sending messages of an intimidating or threatening nature.
sentences: Cyberbullying is a serious problem that can hurt people.
Never participate in cyberbullying; it's wrong.
If you experience cyberbullying, tell a trusted adult.

words.definition: The correct or acceptable way of communicating on the Internet.
sentences: Good netiquette means being respectful online.
Always follow netiquette when posting in online forums.
Learning netiquette helps you communicate better online.

words.definition: Software that is specifically designed to disrupt, damage, or gain unauthorized access to a computer system.
sentences: Malware can slow down your computer and steal data.
Always be careful about downloading files to avoid malware.
Antivirus software helps protect against malware.

words.definition: Software that enables a user to obtain covert information about another's computer activities by transmitting data covertly from their hard drive.
sentences: Spyware can track your online activities without your knowledge.
Install anti-spyware programs to protect your privacy.
Be cautious of free software that might contain spyware.

words.definition: Software that automatically displays or downloads advertising material (often unwanted) to a user's computer.
sentences: Adware can cause annoying pop-up ads.
Some free programs come bundled with adware.
Use an ad blocker to reduce adware.

words.definition: A type of malicious software designed to block access to a computer system until a sum of money is paid.
sentences: Ransomware attacks can lock your files until you pay a fee.
Always back up your data to protect against ransomware.
Companies are often targets of ransomware attacks.

words.definition: A device that converts digital signals into analog signals for transmission over a phone line or cable, and vice versa.
sentences: The modem is the first device that connects to your internet service.
You typically need both a modem and a router for home internet.
The internet light on the modem should be solid.

words.definition: A system for connecting computers within a local area network (LAN) using cables.
sentences: I connected my computer to the router using an Ethernet cable.
Ethernet provides a more stable and faster connection than Wi-Fi.
Many offices use Ethernet for their network connections.

words.definition: A facility allowing computers, smartphones, or other devices to connect to the Internet or communicate with one another wirelessly within a particular area.
sentences: I can access the internet using Wi-Fi at school.
Our Wi-Fi signal is strong in the living room.
Many public places offer free Wi-Fi.

words.definition: A satellite-based navigation system used to determine the precise location on Earth.
sentences: My phone uses GPS to show me directions.
GPS helps drivers find their way.
Many apps use GPS to provide location-based services.

words.definition: Conducting a conference between two or more participants at different sites by using computer networks to transmit audio and video data.
sentences: We had a video conferencing meeting with our team members in other cities.
Video conferencing became very popular during the pandemic.
Many online classes use video conferencing platforms.

words.definition: A video camera that feeds its images in real time to a computer or computer network, often used for video calls.
sentences: I use my webcam for online classes.
Make sure your webcam is turned on for the video call.
Some laptops have a built-in webcam.

words.definition: An instrument for converting sound waves into electrical energy, which may then be amplified, transmitted, or recorded.
sentences: Speak clearly into the microphone during the call.
My computer has a built-in microphone.
A good microphone is important for clear audio.

words.definition: A pair of earphones typically joined by a band placed over the head, for listening to audio signals such as music or speech.
sentences: I wear headphones when I'm listening to music so I don't disturb others.
Headphones are great for online learning.
My new headphones have noise cancellation.

words.definition: An electronic device that converts electrical signals into sound.
sentences: The sound came out of the computer speakers.
We need louder speakers for the party.
My phone's speaker is very clear.

words.definition: The ability to display the content of one computer screen on another computer screen, often during a video call.
sentences: During the online meeting, we used screen sharing to show our presentation.
Screen sharing helps when collaborating on documents.
Can you use screen sharing so I can see what you're doing?

words.definition: An online seminar or presentation conducted over the Internet.
sentences: I learned a lot from the webinar on coding.
Many companies host webinars to introduce new products.
The webinar allowed participants to ask questions live.

words.definition: An electronic version of a printed book that can be read on a computer or a specially designed handheld device.
sentences: I prefer reading e-books on my tablet.
You can download many free e-books online.
E-books are convenient for travel as they save space.

words.definition: A course of study that is delivered over the Internet.
sentences: I'm taking an online course to learn graphic design.
Online courses offer flexibility for students.
Many universities offer online courses now.

words.definition: An online learning environment where students and teachers interact through the internet.
sentences: Our virtual classroom uses video and chat for lessons.
The virtual classroom allows students from different places to learn together.
I feel comfortable learning in a virtual classroom.

words.definition: The ability to find, evaluate, create, and communicate information using digital technologies.
sentences: Digital literacy is an important skill for everyone today.
Learning digital literacy helps you navigate the online world safely.
Schools teach digital literacy to prepare students for the future.

words.definition: The practice of protecting computer systems and networks from digital attacks.
sentences: Cybersecurity experts work to keep online information safe.
Learning about cybersecurity can protect you from scams.
Good cybersecurity practices are essential for businesses.

words.definition: A program that identifies and removes unwanted junk email.
sentences: My email's spam filter catches most of the junk mail.
A good spam filter saves you time by cleaning your inbox.
Sometimes important emails can accidentally go into the spam filter.

words.definition: A privacy feature in web browsers that prevents your browsing history, cookies, and site data from being saved.
sentences: I use incognito mode when I'm shopping for a gift online.
Incognito mode doesn't save your browsing history.
Remember that incognito mode doesn't hide your activity from your internet provider.

words.definition: A service that encrypts your internet connection and hides your IP address, making your online activity more private.
sentences: Using a VPN can help protect your online privacy.
Many people use a VPN when connecting to public Wi-Fi.
A VPN can make it seem like you are browsing from a different location.

words.definition: A unique numerical label assigned to each device connected to a computer network that uses the Internet Protocol for communication.
sentences: Your IP address identifies your device on the internet.
A VPN can change your visible IP address.
Every website you visit records your IP address.

words.definition: The unique name that identifies a website on the Internet, like 'google.com'.
sentences: Our company bought a new domain name for our website.
A good domain name is easy to remember.
You type the domain name into the browser to visit a site.

words.definition: The complete address of a web page or file on the Internet.
sentences: The URL for our school website is very long.
Always check the URL to make sure you're on the right website.
I copied the URL to share the link with my friend.

words.definition: The set of rules for transferring files (text, graphic images, sound, video, and other multimedia files) on the World Wide Web.
sentences: Most websites start with 'http://' or 'https://'.
HTTP is the foundation of data communication for the web.
Secure websites use HTTPS, which is a safer version of HTTP.

words.definition: A secure version of HTTP that encrypts communication between your browser and the website.
sentences: Always look for 'https://' in the address bar when shopping online.
HTTPS ensures your data is protected during transmission.
Websites with HTTPS have a padlock icon in the browser.

words.definition: A high-capacity transmission technique using a wide range of frequencies, which enables a large number of messages to be communicated simultaneously.
sentences: Broadband internet is essential for modern homes.
We have a fast broadband connection at home.
Most internet providers now offer broadband services.

words.definition: A device that directs internet traffic between your local network and the wider internet.
sentences: The router helps all my devices connect to the internet.
I had to reset the router to fix the internet problem.
Place your router in a central location for better Wi-Fi coverage.

words.definition: A device that allows a computer to send and receive data over telephone lines or cable.
sentences: The modem converts the internet signal from the cable company.
You need a modem to get internet service at home.
Check the lights on your modem if your internet isn't working.

words.definition: The delivery of computing servicesâ€”including servers, storage, databases, networking, software, analytics, and intelligenceâ€”over the Internet ('the cloud').
sentences: Cloud computing allows businesses to store data without owning physical servers.
Many popular apps use cloud computing to function.
Learning about cloud computing is important in tech.

words.definition: A large group of networked computer servers typically used for remote storage, processing, or distribution of large amounts of data.
sentences: Major internet companies operate huge data centers.
Data centers require a lot of electricity to run.
Our online information is stored in secure data centers.

words.definition: The development of computer systems able to perform tasks that normally require human intelligence, such as visual perception, speech recognition, decision-making, and translation between languages.
sentences: AI is used in many digital communication tools, like chatbots.
Some smartphones use AI for facial recognition.
AI is rapidly changing how we interact with technology.

words.definition: A type of artificial intelligence that allows computer systems to learn from data without being explicitly programmed.
sentences: Machine learning helps email programs identify spam.
Recommendation systems on streaming services use machine learning.
ML is a powerful tool for analyzing large amounts of data.

words.definition: Extremely large data sets that may be analyzed computationally to reveal patterns, trends, and associations, especially relating to human behavior and interactions.
sentences: Companies use big data to understand customer preferences.
Analyzing big data can lead to new discoveries.
Big data is a key concept in modern digital communication.

words.definition: The right of an individual to control the collection and use of their personal information.
sentences: Data privacy is a growing concern in the digital age.
New laws are being created to protect data privacy.
Always read privacy policies to understand how your data is used.

words.definition: The moral principles that govern the use of computers and the Internet.
sentences: Cyber ethics teaches us to be responsible online citizens.
Understanding cyber ethics is crucial for safe digital communication.
Schools often teach students about cyber ethics.

words.definition: The responsible use of technology by anyone who uses computers, the Internet, and digital devices to engage with society on any level.
sentences: Practicing good digital citizenship means being respectful and safe online.
Digital citizenship includes understanding online rights and responsibilities.
Our school promotes digital citizenship among students.

words.definition: The amount of time spent looking at a screen, such as on a smartphone, tablet, or computer.
sentences: Too much screen time can be bad for your eyes.
Parents often limit their children's screen time.
I try to balance my screen time with outdoor activities.

words.definition: A period of time during which a person refrains from using electronic devices such as smartphones or computers, regarded as an opportunity to reduce stress or focus on social interaction in the physical world.
sentences: I'm going on a digital detox this weekend to relax.
A digital detox can help improve your mental well-being.
Many people find a digital detox refreshing.

words.definition: Alerts or messages that appear on your screen to inform you about new activity, such as a new message or update.
sentences: My phone is constantly buzzing with notifications.
You can customize which app notifications you receive.
Too many notifications can be distracting.

words.definition: A message that pops up on a mobile device, sent by an app or website, even when the app is not open.
sentences: I got a push notification about a breaking news story.
Push notifications keep you updated on your favorite apps.
You can turn off push notifications if they bother you.

words.definition: A group of people who interact with each other primarily through the Internet, sharing common interests or goals.
sentences: I joined an online community for people who love reading.
Online communities can provide support and information.
Many hobbies have active online communities.

words.definition: A series of messages on an online forum or social media platform that are related to the same topic.
sentences: I followed the entire thread about the new movie.
The discussion thread became very long.
Someone started a new thread about healthy eating.

words.definition: To respond to a message or post online.
sentences: I need to reply to my friend's email.
She quickly replied to my text message.
He posted a funny reply in the comments section.

words.definition: A private message sent directly to another user on a social media platform, not visible to others.
sentences: I sent a direct message to my favorite artist.
You can send a DM to ask a private question.
She received a DM from a new follower.

words.definition: An online conversation involving three or more people, allowing multiple participants to send and receive messages simultaneously.
sentences: We have a group chat for our class project.
My family uses a group chat to plan events.
Group chats are great for coordinating with friends.

words.definition: A live video conversation over the internet.
sentences: I had a video call with my grandparents last night.
Video calls are useful for remote meetings.
We use video calls to stay connected with family abroad.

words.definition: A camera connected to a computer, used for video calls or recording videos.
sentences: My laptop has a built-in webcam.
Make sure your webcam is working before the online class.
I bought an external webcam for better video quality.

words.definition: A device consisting of a pair of headphones with a microphone, used for communication.
sentences: I use a headset for online gaming.
A good headset improves clarity during video calls.
He wore his headset during the virtual meeting.

words.definition: An online seminar or presentation conducted over the Internet.
sentences: I attended a webinar on digital marketing.
Many educational institutions offer free webinars.
The webinar included a Q&A session at the end.

words.definition: To broadcast live video or audio over the Internet.
sentences: The concert was available to livestream online.
Many gamers livestream their gameplay.
We watched the news livestream on our phones.

words.definition: A video blog, a personal online journal presented in video format.
sentences: She posts a new travel vlog every week.
Vlogs are popular for sharing personal experiences.
My favorite vlogger shares tips on healthy eating.

words.definition: A digital audio series that can be downloaded or streamed online.
sentences: I listen to a true crime podcast on my commute.
There are podcasts available on almost any topic.
My friend started a podcast about local history.

words.definition: The buying and selling of goods and services using the Internet.
sentences: Online shopping is a form of e-commerce.
E-commerce has made it easier to buy things from anywhere.
Many businesses now rely on e-commerce.

words.definition: Managing your bank accounts and performing financial transactions over the Internet.
sentences: I use online banking to pay my bills.
Online banking is convenient and saves time.
Make sure to use a secure connection for online banking.

words.definition: An electronic device or online service that allows an individual to make electronic transactions.
sentences: I pay for things using my digital wallet on my phone.
Digital wallets make payments quick and easy.
Many apps now include a digital wallet feature.

words.definition: A machine-readable optical label that contains information about the item to which it is attached.
sentences: Scan the QR code to connect to the Wi-Fi.
QR codes are used for quick access to websites or information.
I used a QR code to download the restaurant menu.

words.definition: An online platform that delivers digital media content (like movies, music, or TV shows) to users over the Internet.
sentences: Netflix is a popular streaming service for movies and TV shows.
I subscribe to a music streaming service.
Streaming services have changed how we consume entertainment.

words.definition: An agreement to receive something regularly, often by paying a fee, like for a streaming service or magazine.
sentences: I have a monthly subscription to a gaming service.
Many apps offer a free trial before requiring a subscription.
My news subscription gives me access to exclusive articles.

words.definition: A list of songs or videos compiled for playback, often on a streaming service.
sentences: I created a playlist of my favorite workout songs.
Share your playlist with me!
The DJ made a great playlist for the party.

words.definition: A regularly updated website or web page, typically one run by an individual or small group, that is written in an informal or conversational style.
sentences: She writes a blog about her travel adventures.
I read a food blog to find new recipes.
Starting a blog is a good way to share your thoughts.

words.definition: An online seminar or presentation conducted over the Internet.
sentences: I attended a webinar about digital art.
Many companies offer free webinars to teach new skills.
The webinar was very informative.

words.definition: A word or phrase preceded by a hash symbol (#) used on social media to group related content.
sentences: Use a hashtag to make your post more visible.
The event went viral with the hashtag #BestDayEver.
I searched for posts using the hashtag #ScienceFacts.

words.definition: An image, video, piece of text, etc., that is copied (often with slight variations) and spread rapidly by Internet users.
sentences: That meme about cats is so relatable.
Memes are a form of internet humor.
The internet is full of funny memes.

words.definition: An online seminar or presentation conducted over the Internet.
sentences: I attended a webinar about digital art.
Many companies offer free webinars to teach new skills.
The webinar was very informative.
